original_title: CBSL releases Sri Lanka Socio-Economic Data – 2024 publication
original_body_lines: “Sri Lanka Socio-Economic Data – 2024”, the annually published data folder of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, is now available for public information.

The current data folder is the 47th volume of the series. This easy-to-carry booklet contains information categorised under 14 topics, namely, Country Profile; Key Economic Indicators; Country Comparisons; Socio Economic Conditions; Human Resources; National Accounts; Agriculture; Industry; Economic and Social Infrastructure; Prices and Wages; External Trade and Tourism; External Finance; Government Finance; and Money, Banking and Finance.

As the data folder presents a wide range of socio-economic data of current interest in summary form, it will be a very useful reference material for policy makers, researchers, academics, professionals, students and the general public. The electronic version of the publication can be accessed through the Central Bank website (http://www.cbsl.gov.lk).

A limited number of copies of the printed version of the publication will be available for sale for a price of Rs. 50/- at the Sales and Distribution Counter of the Central Bank located at the Central Point Building (Chatham Street, Colombo 01), Tel:011-2444502.
ADB encouraged to see policy rates beginning to normalise in Sri Lanka
